javadoc:
This class maintains a collection of {@link ColumnConstraint} that are applied to a specific table column for filtering purposes. In order for this ColumnConstraintSet to "pass", (i.e. accept the table row) the column value for that row must pass at least one of the constraints in this set, thus effectively OR'ing the constraints.

Instances of this class are used by the {@link ColumnBasedTableFilter} to filter rows of table. @param the row type of the table being filtered. @param the column type of column whose values are being tested by this filter.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: columnIndex
params.comment: the index of the column whose values are tested by this filter.

params.name: constraints
params.comment: the list of ColumnConstraints whose results are or'ed together.

params.name: logicOperation
params.comment: the logical operation for how this constraintSet relates to other contraint sets.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructor when deserializing from a SaveState

params.name: saveState
params.comment: the SaveState which contains the configuration for this filter.

methods.javadoc:
Return the name of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.
@return the name of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.
methods.name: getColumnName
methods.comment: Return the name of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.

return.comment: the name of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the model index of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.
@return the model index of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.
methods.name: getColumnModelIndex
methods.comment: Returns the model index of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.

return.comment: the model index of the column whose values will be tested by this filter.

methods.name: accepts
methods.comment: Return true if the given table row object passes this filter.

params.name: context
params.comment: the TableFilterContext for this table's filter.

return.comment: true if the given table row object passes this filter.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of ColumnConstraints in this ColumnFilter
@return a list of ColumnConstraints in this ColumnFilter
methods.name: getConstraints
methods.comment: Returns a list of ColumnConstraints in this ColumnFilter

return.comment: a list of ColumnConstraints in this ColumnFilter

methods.name: getLogicOperation
methods.comment:
Returns the logical operation (AND or OR) for how to combine this object's #accepts(Object, TableFilterContext)
 results with the results of previous constraintSet results in the overall filter.

methods.name: getHtmlRepresentation
methods.comment:
Returns an HTML representation of this constraint set in a tabular form. It will be used
 inside the HTML representation of the entire filter. See ColumnBasedTableFilter#getHtmlRepresentation()
 for a description of the table format.

methods.name: isStringBasedConstraint
methods.comment:
Returns true if this is a String constraint or a type converting constraint where the type
 is converted to a string constraint. (i.e. uses a String editor)

return.comment: true if this is a String constraint or something that is converted to a string constraint.

name: ColumnConstraintSet
comment:
This class maintains a collection of ColumnConstraint that are applied to a specific table column
 for filtering purposes. In order for this ColumnConstraintSet to "pass", (i.e. accept the table
 row) the column value for that row must pass at least one of the constraints in this set, thus
 effectively OR'ing the constraints.

  Instances of this class are used by the ColumnBasedTableFilter to filter rows of table.
